channel.title: MBallSectionsDR
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Illinois Is Mandating Mental Health Screenings for Kids. Parents Beware
item.description: This is a profound government overreach.

item.title: ‘Nobody Deserves That’: Mom Of D.C. Crime Victim Says Nation’s Capital Needs Intervention
item.description: Congressional intern Eric Tarpinian-Jachym died because D.C.'s local leadership isn't willing to enforce the law.

item.title: Zelenskyy to meet Trump in Washington Monday
item.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy will travel to the White House on Monday to meet with President Trump to discuss a potential peace deal.

item.title: Fixing Elite Universities Means Firing Bad Trustees, Starting with Harvard’s
item.description: Plus, federal arts agencies may be at death’s door, but they’re still making grants.

item.title: Why Is Trump Imposing Tariffs on Israel?
item.description: Continuing tariffs on Israeli goods exemplifies the overreach of Trump’s policy.

item.title: The ‘No Deal’ Summit and the Path to Peace in Ukraine
item.description: For any American intervention to be successful, before long it will have to involve more stick, as well as carrot.

item.title: Report Exposes How Gender-Extremism Group Pressures Hospitals To Damage Children
item.description: The report explains how the Human Rights Campaign pressures hospitals into child castration to service 'transgender' ideology.

item.title: In Trump's redistricting push, Democrats find an aggressive identity and progressives are on board

item.title: Trump: Xi Jinping won't invade Taiwan while he's president
item.description: President Trump said he was informed by Chinese President Xi Jinping that the Chinese military won't invade Taiwan during his time in office.

item.title: DC Attorney General Sues Feds To Stop Trump Admin From Cleaning Up Crime
item.description: 'It is my opinion that the Bondi Order is unlawful, and that you are not legally obligated to follow it,' Schwalb said.
